HDG.ID.content: German idealism, where abode (Unterkunft) [compare to arrival] is found for radiant emergence of mediation w/in identity, abode for synthetic essence of identity
HDG.ID.linkedContent: German idealism, where abode (Unterkunft) [compare to arrival] is found for radiant emergence of mediation w/in identity, abode for synthetic essence of identity

HDG.ID.content: now difference becomes Being of beings [how?] > Being that is beings where “is” speaks transitively, in transition > Being transits over (that) which arrives: arrival (Ankunft) means: “to keep concealed in unconcealedness—to abide present in this keeping—to be a being”

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

HDG.ID.linkedContent: now difference becomes Being of beings [how?] > Being that is beings where “is” speaks transitively, in transition > Being transits over (that) which arrives: arrival (Ankunft) means: “to keep concealed in unconcealedness—to abide present in this keeping—to be a being”

HDG.ID.content: Being as unconcealing overwhelming (enterbergenden überkommnis), beings in sense of arrival (Ankunft): are present, thus differentiated, by virtue of the Same, the differentiation > “the difference of Being & beings, as the differentiation of overwhelming & arrival, is the perdurance (Austrag) of the 2 in the unconcealing keeping in concealment” > being apart & toward each other of overwhelming/arrival: clearing of what veils & closes itself off

HDG.ID.content: out of oblivion of difference as such to think difference as perdurance of unconcealing overcoming & self-keeping arrival [why? why would spacing say something about Being’s destiny, its all-pervasiveness] > Being’s possible all-pervasiveness not universal, not a law guaranteeing a dialectical process

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.IWM.content: at stake: attentiveness (Achten) to arrival (Ankunft) of hitherto unspoken essence of unconcealedness Being has announced (angekündigt) itself to be [cf. 280n X Being, also Being, truth, world, Ereignis] [multiple names]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: at stake: attentiveness (Achten) to arrival (Ankunft) of hitherto unspoken essence of unconcealedness Being has announced (angekündigt) itself to be [cf. 280n X Being, also Being, truth, world, Ereignis] [multiple names]

HDG.FS.content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

HDG.LP.content: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.LP.linkedContent: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]

HDG.LP.content: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity
HDG.LP.linkedContent: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity

HDG.LP.content: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being
HDG.LP.linkedContent: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.EC.content: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.EC.linkedContent: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
